text:
I wanted to find out something. If you are running a content marketing agency or a content marketing team at an organization where you have to deal with multiple clients or multiple writers or both, how do you manage it? I mean keeping the track of assignments, deadlines, word count, invoices & payouts, reworks, etc. Generally, I have seen people using Excel or Google Sheets and Notion.

Does anyone do it differently here?

text:
Canva Q:
I feel like a total dumbass but I cannot figure out how to add an image from a Canva folder to a design.
When i organized my uploaded images into folders, they vanished from the uploads view and went into the folders (which I can see in each folder).
But now that i want to use some of these images for a design, I don't know how to get it out of the folder into a design.
What am I missing?

elements.text:
Canva Q:
I feel like a total dumbass but I cannot figure out how to add an image from a Canva folder to a design.
When i organized my uploaded images into folders, they vanished from the uploads view and went into the folders (which I can see in each folder).
But now that i want to use some of these images for a design, I don't know how to get it out of the folder into a design.
What am I missing?

text:
How do you set Content Marketing KPIs? If this topic has been discussed before please point me towards it.

I am conflicted between -

1. Treating content as a brand marketing initiative and not looking at numbers. And just looking at the qualititave feedback that I get. More like a Seth Godin approach to marketing. I believe Dave Gerhardt has the same philosophy.

AND

2. Using funnel metrics like Traffic, Subscribers, engagement, etc. to measure content effectiveness.

How do I think about this?

elements.text:
How do you set Content Marketing KPIs? If this topic has been discussed before please point me towards it.

I am conflicted between -

1. Treating content as a brand marketing initiative and not looking at numbers. And just looking at the qualititave feedback that I get. More like a Seth Godin approach to marketing. I believe Dave Gerhardt has the same philosophy.

AND

2. Using funnel metrics like Traffic, Subscribers, engagement, etc. to measure content effectiveness.

How do I think about this?
